items.sentence: Tom said he isn\'t planning to buy anything.
Our boss doesn\'t let us take coffee breaks.
Our problems are nothing compared to Tom\'s.
It\'s warmer in the house. Let\'s go inside.
Tom became deeply interested in art history.
Tom bought two tickets and a bag of popcorn.
Tom can hardly hear without his hearing aid.
Tom carried two boxes into the storage room.
Tom looked like he hadn\'t shaved in a week.
Tom looked like he wasn\'t enjoying himself.
I didn\'t know that Tom was studying French.
I didn\'t know that someone was watching me.
I didn\'t know that you two knew each other.
I didn\'t know the truth until this morning.
I didn\'t know this kind of a thing existed.
Tom said he found a wallet in the back seat.
Tom said he had more important things to do.
Tom said he was calling from his cell phone.
Tom sat at his desk, staring out the window.
There\'ll come a day when you\'ll regret it.
